intro: Macrochaetium hexandrum, commonly known as the six-stamen grass, is a flowering plant belonging to the grass family Poaceae. It is characterized by its slender, erect stems and narrow, linear leaves. The plant produces small, spike-like inflorescences that bear tiny, two-lipped flowers. It is typically found in moist, open habitats such as meadows and wetlands. Its botanical features make it an important species for ecological studies in its native range.
